attributes.action: Not as The Times put it, "curb the role of the Navy".
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government has called these "Uncertain times", and in these uncertain times, in seems ridicules that funds which were promised in the Budget, are to be directed away to other causes.
How is it that in this Country, with its proud military history, £100 billion can be found to help a struggling bank to recover, but the comparitively meagre funds needed to build the ships that the government promised can not?
It is clear from the constant news stories and petitions that the public does not want our Navy, nor our military rediced in such a way, so there really is no excuse for doing so and it must be reversed.

Russian Navy- 6 aircraft carriers planned

Royal Navy- 2

Russian GDP- $1.3 trillion

British GDP- $2.8 trillion

Does that make sense?

rejection.details: Similar to a number of petitions including: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/Britainsmilitary
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
